snippet: The indictment secured by the special counsel makes it clear that Facebook was used extensively in the campaign to disrupt the 2016 election. How did Russia do it?

headline: On Russia, Facebook Sends a Message It Wishes It Hadn’t
snippet: Some Facebook executives still seem more interested in defending themselves from criticism than owning their mistakes related to the 2016 election.

headline: On Social Media, Lax Enforcement Lets Impostor Accounts Thrive
snippet: Millions of “bots” posing as real users are promoting celebrities, spreading misinformation and sowing discord. And it’s far easier to build a bot than to kill one.

headline: Fact-Checking a Facebook Executive’s Comments on Russian Interference
snippet: Rob Goldman, Facebook vice president for ads, tweeted about Russia’s disinformation effort. President Trump then cited him. We fact-checked Mr. Goldman.

headline: After Florida School Shooting, Russian ‘Bot’ Army Pounced
snippet: Twitter accounts suspected of having links to Russia were focused on Robert Mueller. But after news broke about the shooting, they quickly changed their focus.

headline: Why A.I. Researchers at Google Got Desks Next to the Boss
snippet: At Google, Facebook and other tech companies, executives are making statements about priorities with their seating charts.

headline: How Unwitting Americans Encountered Russian Operatives Online
snippet: With imperfect English and tireless posting on Facebook and Twitter, Russian trolls summoned Americans to rallies, praised Donald J. Trump and played on political divisions.

headline: To Stir Discord in 2016, Russians Turned Most Often to Facebook
snippet: The special counsel’s indictment detailed how crucial Facebook and Instagram were to the Russian campaign to disrupt the presidential election.

headline: Brazil Looks to Crack Down on Fake News Ahead of Bitter Election
snippet: Officials from the judiciary and law enforcement are teaming up to try to prevent voters from being misled, arguing that freedom of speech cannot come at the cost of a tainted election.

headline: New York City Sues Drug Companies Over Opioid Crisis
snippet: The city is suing Big Pharma drug companies over the opioid crisis, two weeks after filing a suit against oil companies over climate change costs.

headline: Curating Band-Aids, Both Modern and Vintage
snippet: As chief historian for Johnson & Johnson, Margaret Gurowitz organizes and maintains its museums, physical and virtual.

headline: Can Your Hip Replacement Kill You?
snippet: Many medical devices on the market have undergone no clinical testing at all.

headline: Sanofi, Facing Threat From Generics, Moves to Buy Hemophilia Drug Maker
snippet: The $11.6 billion deal for Bioverativ would bolster the French pharmaceutical giants portfolio as it faces falling sales for its diabetes drug, Lantus.

headline: Companies Warn of Hits From Tax Cuts. Dont Be Fooled.
snippet: Companies are expected to report billions of dollars in short-term losses stemming from the new tax law. But they are a prelude to much larger profits.

headline: Made in China: New and Potentially Lifesaving Drugs
snippet: A growing number of Chinese pharmaceutical companies are trying to break into the United States, seeking regulatory approval to offer their treatments for cancer and other ailments.

headline: Massachusetts, a Health Pioneer, Turns Its Focus to Drug Prices. Its in for a Fight.
snippet: A state proposal to limit the number of drugs covered by Medicaid, fiercely opposed by patients and drug companies, has drawn national attention as states struggle to pay for costly new medicines.

headline: Why Cant Dying Patients Get the Drugs They Want?
snippet: A Republican-backed Right to Try bill would allow patients to sidestep F.D.A. approval. But the true gatekeepers are the drug companies themselves.

headline: Can This Judge Solve the Opioid Crisis?
snippet: The Ohio federal judge overseeing hundreds of opioid lawsuits wants a swift settlement with solutions. But first he must tame skeptical legal lions.

headline: Justice Dept. Backs High-Stakes Lawsuit Against Opioid Makers
snippet: Attorney General Jeff Sessions said he would use legal actions and task forces to crack down on prescription opioid manufacturers, distributors and prescribers.

headline: Two Prostate Cancer Drugs Delay Spread of the Disease by Two Years
snippet: The treatments could help hundreds of thousands of men worldwide stave off pain and chemotherapy, but researchers dont yet know if they will extend lives.

headline: New Index Rates Drug Companies in Fight Against Superbugs
snippet: Glaxo and Johnson & Johnson top a new measure of how drugmakers do against antibiotic-resistant bacteria, which are becoming a global emergency.

headline: The U.K. Has Banned Microbeads. Why?
snippet: Theyre tiny, colorful and harmless-looking, but these little pellets are being blamed for causing big problems.
